executiveSummary: Entrepreneurs Shaquille Walker, Jared Ward, and Jonatha Perry from Utah pitched MyoStorm, makers of the Meteor—a heated vibrating massage ball designed to relieve pain and accelerate muscle recovery. Seeking $150,000 for 10% equity, they received multiple offers and ultimately accepted a deal from Lori Greiner after declining similar offers from other sharks.
keyDecisions: The MyoStorm founders accepted Lori Greiner’s offer for $150,000 in exchange for 10% equity.

actionItems.task: Work with Lori Greiner to refine product design and explore cost reduction strategies for manufacturing
Develop plan to scale production to reach 10,000-unit manufacturing volume and reduce cost per unit
Implement marketing strategy focused on direct-to-consumer sales and athlete endorsements

nextSteps: The MyoStorm team will collaborate with Lori Greiner to lower manufacturing costs, increase production, and expand distribution of the Meteor through both direct-to-consumer and potential retail channels.
